intro: Paesia rugulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf paesia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
